But it happened earlier today on a main road between Damascus airport and the Syrian capital.</p><p>These sorts of attacks are extremely rare in Syria. </p><p>So who is behind it?</p><p>Well, the explosion occurred near some Syrian military intelligence offices. Large scale attacks in Syria may be rare, but in recent years, there has been some low-scale religious militant activity by groups opposed to Syria's secular military regime.</p><p>The car that killed at least 17, all of them reportedly civilians, was packed with 200 kilos of explosives.</p><p>Are extremist Sunni militants shifting to a higher gear in Syria?</p><p>Perhaps, but let's keep in mind the blast rocked an area close to a major Shia shrine. Could the attackers have attempted to target pilgrims?</p><p>Regardless of who is responsible, this will have hardline regime authorities - an ordinary Syrians - worried.</p><p><span style="font-size:85%;">(Photo AP - a man cleans up debris after an explosion blew out windows and damaged property in a Damascus suburb.)</span></p>
